definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Golden, with a very fine cordon of bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 金黃色的酒液，還有精緻的小氣泡。

sentences.english: High viscosity oils produce foam with small bubbles that do not break easily.
sentences.chinese: 高粘度油產生泡沫的小氣泡，不容易突破。

sentences.english: Japanese firms have tried to be as penny-pinching on pay in their foreign operations as they have at home.
sentences.chinese: 日本企業在外國試圖像它們在國內那樣小氣。

sentences.english: Last, I have to say "bargain" is not niggard.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我要說，討價還價，不等於小氣。

sentences.english: It is well known for its warm micro-climate favorable to lemon, tangerine, and orange groves.
sentences.chinese: 這是衆所周知的溫暖小氣候有利於檸檬，橘子，橙園。

sentences.english: Tom seems rather mean, but he has a kind heart.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆看上去挺小氣，但心地善良。

sentences.english: Foam rubber is soft rubber full of small air-bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 泡沫橡膠是充滿了小氣泡的軟橡膠。

sentences.english: The man. If he agrees to share the check, he can seem like a cheapskate.
sentences.chinese: 如果男人同意AA制，他看起來就像小氣鬼。

sentences.english: Of glass or quartzite marred by small bubbles or small particles of foreign material.
sentences.chinese: 被小氣泡或者異質材料的小微粒所損害。

sentences.english: Soil surface mulching was one of important method to improve the agricultural microclimate.
sentences.chinese: 地面覆蓋法是改善農業小氣候的一種重要措施。

sentences.english: The richer he is, the stingier he becomes.
You must be frank; but without indiscretion; and close, without being costive.
sentences.chinese: 你必須坦誠而不輕率，掌握分寸而不吝嗇小氣。

sentences.english: The notorious cheapskate finally decided to have a party.
sentences.chinese: 一個臭名昭著的小氣鬼決定舉辦一個聚會。

sentences.english: It is a popular misconception (ie Many people wrongly believe) that all Scotsmen are mean.
sentences.chinese: 很多人誤以爲蘇格蘭人都很小氣。

sentences.english: My aunt is too tight- fisted.
You might regard the soil as your enemy because it yields reluctantly a niggardly subsistence.
sentences.chinese: 如果你視土地爲敵人，因爲它吝嗇小氣，僅能飽腹。

definition: to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
